abstract: Warren E. Buffett’s company plans to buy the roughly 1.4 million shares it does not already own of a subsidiary, Wesco Financial, and the news sent Wesco’s stock climbing 12 percent
snippet: Warren E. Buffett’s company plans to buy the roughly 1.4 million shares it does not already own of a subsidiary, Wesco Financial, and the news sent Wesco’s stock climbing 12 percent
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett‘s company, Berkshire Hathaway, said Thursday that it would offer to buy the roughly 1.4 million shares it does not already own of its subsidiary, Wesco Financial, and the news sent Wesco’s stock climbing 12 percent, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Buffett Offers to Buy Rest of Wesco Financial
